TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IXsltContextFunction

summary.span: Provides an interface to a given function defined in the Extensible Stylesheet Language for Transformations (XSLT) style sheet during runtime execution.

span.span: Provides an interface to a given function defined in the Extensible Stylesheet Language for Transformations (XSLT) style sheet during runtime execution.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Para obtener más información sobre el uso de , consulte el artículo Q324899, "Para: implemente y Use personalizado funciones cuando se ejecute XPath consultas en Visual Basic. NET" en Microsoft Knowledge Base en http://support.microsoft.com.For more information on using , see article Q324899, "HOW TO: Implement and Use Custom Functions When You Execute XPath Queries in Visual Basic .NET" in the Microsoft Knowledge Base at http://support.microsoft.com.

summary.span: Gets the supplied XML Path Language (XPath) types for the function's argument list.

span.span: Gets the supplied XML Path Language (XPath) types for the function's argument list.

summary.span: This information can be used to discover the signature of the function which allows you to differentiate between overloaded functions.

span.span: This information can be used to discover the signature of the function which allows you to differentiate between overloaded functions.

value.span: Una matriz de que representan los tipos de lista de argumentos de la función.

span.span: An array of representing the types for the function's argument list.

MemberSignature.Value: public object Invoke (System.Xml.Xsl.XsltContext xsltContext, object[] args, System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator docContext);

param.name: xsltContext
param.span: The XSLT context for the function call.

span.span: The XSLT context for the function call.

param.name: args
param.span: The arguments of the function call.

span.span: The arguments of the function call.

param.span: Each argument is an element in the array.

span.span: Each argument is an element in the array.

param.name: docContext
param.span: The context node for the function call.

span.span: The context node for the function call.

summary.span: Provides the method to invoke the function with the given arguments in the given context.

span.span: Provides the method to invoke the function with the given arguments in the given context.

returns.span: An representing the return value of the function.

span.span: An representing the return value of the function.

remarks.format: ## Remarks El `docContext` parámetro es necesario para que las funciones que requieren un conjunto de nodos se pueden suministrar el nodo de contexto actual.The `docContext` parameter is required so that functions which require a node set can be supplied the current context node.
